section.title: Data Collection for Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.3 and 3.4
section.para: To collect capacity and utilization data for Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization 3.3 and 3.4, you must add CloudForms Management Engine as a user to the RHEV-M database.
Perform this procedure on the PostgreSQL server where the history database is located. Usually, this is the RHEV-M server.

step.para: Using SSH, access the RHEV-M database server as the root user:
Create a new user for the CloudForms Management Engine:
step.screen: postgres=# CREATE ROLE cfme LOGIN UNENCRYPTED PASSWORD 'smartvm' SUPERUSER VALID UNTIL 'infinity';

step.para: Exit to the RHEV-M database server prompt:
Update the server's firewall to accept TCP communication on port 5432:
step.screen: # iptables -I INPUT -p tcp -m tcp --dport 5432 -j ACCEPT # service iptables save
